programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cults young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fingers point at local druids when a farmer is found horribly murdered at a sacred stone circle in Midsomer Mow. But Barnaby is convinced that basic human greed is the real motive for murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a missing tax inspector turns up dead in a vat of cider, Barnaby and Jones must hunt for a giant killer within a Midsomer village steeped in bizarre local traditions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The cloistered world of Midsomer Priory is forced to open its doors to 21st century policing when a nun is strangled to death.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Badger's Drift is again at the centre of attention when local property developer Richard Bayly is found murdered in his own home. Richard had recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. The murder weapon, an Indian sword, is found close by and is discovered to have been stolen in a burglary at the vicarage. Barnaby and Troy set out to discover who would want to kill a dying man.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Nine years before, a series of women was strangled with a neck-tie and left naked in woodland on the edge of Midsomer Worthy. When a Brazilian woman who had recently arrived in the village is also found murdered in the same way within the woods, Barnaby comes up against a retired detective who couldn't solve the previous case, a tobacco company, family arguments and problematic evidence, before other bodies turn up in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A slashed portrait of Jonathan Lowrie in the museum at Aspern Tallow brings Barnaby and Troy to investigate. They find themselves stepping back in time, dealing with a series of ghostly events, the death of elderly Marcus Lowriewho was found in the tomb of his ancestor, a mysterious escaped criminal, a therapist who isn't quite what she seems and a museum trustee with a hidden past. It is not long before the bodies start piling up and things begin to make sense.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Shortly after two groups of travellers arrive in the village of Martyr Warren, local magistrate Hector Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. Barnaby and Troy had to dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers with help from his army friends and learn Hector was a bully and disliked by many who knew him. The detectives have to unravel a tangle of relationships before they track down the culprit.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saints bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely.
